image.altText: Murray Watt crouches down next to a dead fish on the sand at West Beach

props.synopsis: During his visit to Adelaide, the Environment Minister bat away criticism about his government's response to SA's algal bloom crisis. Is $14 million and a 10-minute beach inspection enough to show the Commonwealth cares?

title.children: Is $14m and a 10-minute beach trip enough to show the feds care about the algal bloom?

image.altText: A man in a stripe top and dark jacket walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: A driver accused of killing his passenger in a rollover north of Adelaide was captured on his own dash cam veering out of his lane 26 times in the 20 minutes before the fatal crash, a court has heard.

title.children: 'Lethargic' driver veers out of lane repeatedly before deadly crash, court hears

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Search efforts have recommenced for Mr Story's remains after the 39-year-old was allegedly killed by his partner in Port Lincoln in June.

title.children: Police resume search for remains of alleged murder victim Julian Story

image.altText: Dirty pig standing in mud in piggery

props.synopsis: Fourteen pigs have been put down and 21 Animal Welfare Notices have been issued to a piggery outside Adelaide following leaked footage from inside the facility appearing to show alleged animal abuse.

title.children: Over a dozen pigs euthanased as animal welfare investigation continues

image.altText: Police tape at the front of a brick hosue

props.synopsis: The mother of a man stabbed to death over a dispute about a motorcycle in Adelaide's northern suburbs has told a court how her son's death has created a wound "that can never be healed".

title.children: 'Just another killer': Grieving mum confronts son's stabber

image.altText: A female with brown hair looks down at a wire with a branch wrapped around it.

props.synopsis: Ballooning water prices in Australia's largest wine grape growing region are pushing farmers to the brink amid a global oversupply of some wines and ongoing drought in southern Australia.

title.children: 'We're at breaking point': Drought and soaring water prices push wine grape growers to exit

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with dark hair, wearing an orange jumper

props.synopsis: Tanya Hinrichsen has been re-sentenced for helping her lover and his friend fatally stab and bash her husband in 2018 — after winning a retrial and pleading guilty to a charge of manslaughter. Warning: This story contains content that may distress some readers.

title.children: Wife jailed for role in helping lover fatally stab 'vulnerable' husband

image.altText: Charlotte Walker and Mark Butler at a Labor campaign ev

props.synopsis: The new session of federal parliament is one of the youngest and most diverse ever. What is it like being a younger person in the corridors of power?

title.children: What it's like being the youngest person in parliament

image.altText: A young boy holding an empty pot waiting for food.

props.synopsis: Health officials in the Hamas-controlled Palestinian enclave say starvation is now killing Palestinians at a faster rate than at any point in the 21-month war.

title.children: Baby among 15 to die of starvation in Gaza in one day, say medics

image.altText: Two women wearing University graduation gowns and mortar boards.

props.synopsis: As parliament returns this week for the first time since the election, the top item of business for Labor is its election promise to reduce student loans by 20 per cent.

title.children: How Labor's bill to reduce student debt for 3m people will affect you

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a blue coat looks off camera with a serious expression. Behind her are women wearing scrubs

props.synopsis: With a number of health unions undergoing wage bargaining with a state government elected on a promise to fix the ramping crisis, several unions are getting louder when it comes to challenges continuing to face the healthcare system, writes Kathryn Bermingham.

title.children: Increasing union loudness comes at same time health workers are in pay talks with SA government

image.altText: Elisa and Brent

props.synopsis: A Brisbane couple was devastated when prenatal tests showed the baby they had longed for had a serious genetic abnormality. Then their hospital told them it wouldn't perform a termination, leaving them feeling "abandoned".

title.children: Couple expected 'world-class' care at the Mater, but went 'through hell'

image.altText: French girl with brown hair holds Chinese and French flags seated next to Chinese students on either side in large hall

props.synopsis: Beijing is launching a charm offensive aimed at the younger generation of Australians — because shaping minds today means shaping alliances tomorrow.

title.children: The new front in China's soft power strategy: your kids

image.altText: Man with dark hair and arms crossed looks at camera in office space.

props.synopsis: Research by consumer advocates has found discriminatory policies and rigid regulatory design prevent many First Nations people from accessing their own superannuation, years after the issue was highlighted at the banking royal commission.

title.children: First Nations Australians denied access to own super savings, report finds

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks through white smoke, Susan Ley is about to walk through the smoke too

props.synopsis: During this term of parliament, the prime minister must show bravery and deliver meaningful change in Indigenous affairs, not culture war flashpoints.

title.children: Smoking ceremony may signal new action on Indigenous affairs

image.altText: A police boat on the water

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old boy is dead and another is fighting for life after sustaining a severed arm in a jet ski crash in Sydney's south.

title.children: One boy dead, another fighting for life after Sydney jet ski crash

image.altText: Shot from behind of three young girls playing at a wooden kitchen play set.

props.synopsis: Childcare workers say they understand the distress parents are experiencing after allegations of physical abuse and sexual abuse in childcare centres across Australia.

title.children: Educators reveal childcare red flags for anxious parents to watch for

image.altText: Ali France

props.synopsis: Labor's Ali France says beating Peter Dutton at the May election was an "epic" seven-year journey against "one of the most prolific politicians of our time."

title.children: France speaks about defeating Dutton, pays tribute to her late son

image.altText: Close up shot of DOnald Trump in a blue suit and red tie

props.synopsis: Legal experts say US defamation laws make cases brought forward by public figures "extremely" difficult for them to win.

title.children: Murdoch defamation case could be 'impossible' for Trump to win, experts say

image.altText: A composite image of a man and a woman.

props.synopsis: Greens co-founder Drew Hutton has responded to his expulsion from the party, saying the Greens have lost focus on environmental issues and become "authoritarian and aggressive".

title.children: Greens co-founder slams party as 'authoritarian, aggressive, unlikeable'

image.altText: Scott Bessent speaks at the White House with his hand in the air.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is poised for a strong start, as Wall Street's benchmark index edges out a fresh record high. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set for strong gains as Wall St ekes out fresh record

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Mortgage serviceability buffer to remain at 3pc
Tariff impacts start to be felt, GM reports earnings hit
Trade deal trickle, falling Fed fears keep Wall St around record highs

image.altText: Tobias Johannessen lies on the ground on oxygen after a stage of the Tour de France.

props.synopsis: Norway's Tobias Johannessen remains eighth overall at the Tour de France after collapsing at the finish line of stage 16 atop Mont Ventoux and being taken to hospital.

title.children: Norwegian rider hopeful of continuing Le Tour after mountaintop collapse

image.altText: An older couple sit at their desklooking over paperwork - the woman holds a paper while a man adjusts his glasses as he looks on

props.synopsis: Wondering what your life after work will look like? Here are the practical steps you can take to get the retirement you want — and the things that might hold you back.

title.children: A good retirement isn't guaranteed but these steps might help you get there

image.altText: Two women swimmers are in a pool, holding onto the lane rope and smiling.

props.synopsis: Menstruation can make sport participation prohibitive for women and girls, including a lack of access to period products at venues, but disability can add an additional layer of difficulty.

title.children: Menstruation provides another barrier for para athletes

image.altText: An elderly couple standing in front of an old house which is undergoing minor construction.

props.synopsis: Moved by stories of homelessness, a Tasmanian couple has taken it upon themselves to offer a solution to the state's housing crisis.

title.children: Philanthropic couple buy Hobart property as social housing for older women

image.altText: A man with short buzzed red hair wears dark grey-blue surgical scrubs while sitting in front of a laptop at a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: Warringal Private Hospital terminates neurosurgeon Greg Malham's temporary credentialing after a Four Corners investigation exposes allegations of poor behaviour.

title.children: Private hospital terminates neurosurgeon after Four Corners investigation

image.altText: The wreckage of a motorcycle on a road

props.synopsis: The motorcyclist was hit by a civilian vehicle in the early hours of Wednesday, before colliding with a police car on the M4, leading to heavy traffic.

title.children: Man dies after being hit by car and police vehicle on Sydney's M4

image.altText: Woman with brown hair in a burgundy top leaning against a wooden pole.

props.synopsis: As new Labor MP Ali France enters parliament, the surgeon who saved her life by taking her leg in 2011 is telling his story for the first time.

title.children: 'Life before limb': As Ali France enters parliament the surgeon who saved her speaks out

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Buying or selling in Queensland? Here's how new disclosure laws could cost you more or crash your contract. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: A $3M 'headache' predicted from new Queensland real estate laws

image.altText: A group of protestors stand outside at night holding a big sign saying JUSTICA POR DOM E BRUNO with pictures of both men

props.synopsis: Three years ago, a British journalist and a Brazilian ranger disappeared in the Amazon. A new podcast tells their story, and shows how the fight for the forest impacts us all.

title.children: In 2022, two men disappeared in the Amazon. Their story is now a podcast

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: Not a single medical school in Australia currently offers the option to go part-time, but mother and student Lisa Ross is calling for change.

title.children: Medical student says part-time option could prevent exodus of doctors

image.altText: Trees surround a yellow multi-storey hotel building.

props.synopsis: The Frontier Hotel in Darwin has been stood up as a makeshift detention centre for alleged illegal foreign fishers, amid a surge in vessels caught in northern Australian waters.

title.children: Darwin CBD hotel quietly turned into detention centre for illegal fishers

image.altText: A slender bird with light brown and black feathers, standing in dry grassland.

props.synopsis: Decades after the brown stone-curlew went extinct on Phillip Island, scientists reintroduce the species and hope the eradication of foxes will enable the flock to grow in the wild again.

title.children: Curlews return to fox-free Phillip Island, 40 years after last sighting
